conversation.content:
[nervous] I don't know if you remember me, but, um, I've been trying to find you for—well, honestly, for months now. [clearing throat] My name is Sarah Chen, and you, [shaky voice] you saved my life five years ago. June 14th, 2019. [pause] I was the, uh, the car accident victim who came in with—God, I mean, they told me later I was basically dying when the ambulance brought me in. [emotional] Internal bleeding, collapsed lung, the whole thing was just... [trailing off]

[warm] You probably don't even remember because I'm sure you save so many people, but like, [speeding up] you held my hand when I was terrified, and you kept telling me I was going to see my daughter graduate, and I did! [excited] She graduated last month! Pre-med, actually, because of you. [laugh] 

I know this is, er, kind of weird, me showing up at your hospital like this, [hesitantly] but the thing is, I needed to—I had to tell you that, [very sincerely] because of what you did that night, I got to be there for everything. Her prom, her college acceptance, all of it. [crying while speaking] You gave me my life back when I was literally dying on that table. [sniffle] So, anyway, I just... [happy] thank you doesn't even begin to cover it, but thank you.
